definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: Forgive me for mixing up meters with kilometers, but you have to convert that, of course, to meters.
sentences.chinese: 原諒我弄混，米和千米，但你們當然得，轉換成米。

sentences.english: I'm mixing it up with a line of Keats, and I'm going to say something else about Keats.
sentences.chinese: 我把它和濟慈的一句詩弄混了，待會兒我再講濟慈。

sentences.english: It's important not to get these two classes confused.
The leader apologized and claimed he was confused by the dates.
sentences.chinese: 那位帶頭人表示道歉並聲稱他弄混了日期。

sentences.english: You have confused the meanings of the two words.
sentences.chinese: 你把這兩個詞的意思弄混了。

sentences.english: I always mix up the twins .
sentences.chinese: 我總是把這對雙胞胎弄混。

sentences.english: Do not mix the two covenants.
sentences.chinese: 不要把這兩個約弄混了。

sentences.english: His long lecture confused about the topic.
sentences.chinese: 他的長篇演講把講題都弄混了。

sentences.english: He confuses the two, mixing up details about the first expedition with those of the second.
sentences.chinese: 他將忽必烈第一次和第二次遠征的細節弄混了。

sentences.english: Therefore, you must be careful not to mix them up.
sentences.chinese: 因此，必須注意不能將它們弄混。

sentences.english: To begin with, you have confused two different things.
sentences.chinese: 首先，你已經把兩種東西弄混了。

sentences.english: It is easy to confuse the two most well known animals in Peru.
sentences.chinese: 祕魯的兩種知名動物很容易被弄混。

sentences.english: Even my girlfriend said she kept getting the two of us mixed up when she was watching a game on television.
sentences.chinese: 甚至我的女朋友在看電視時都會把我倆弄混。

sentences.english: I often confuse Lee with his brother.
sentences.chinese: 我常把李和他的弟弟弄混了。

sentences.english: We overlook big things, forget details, conflate events.
sentences.chinese: 我們會忽略大的事情，忘記細節，也會將事情弄混。

definition: to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
to make a fool of oneself
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
